channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Will Iran’s war with Israel and US jack up oil prices in India?
Iran fires missiles towards Cyrus. Are UK bases at risk?
Ayatollah Khamenei, Mohammad Pakpour and more: Top Iranian leaders killed in US-Israel strikes
Could Reza Pahlavi, the son of Iran’s last Shah, return after Khamenei’s death?
What happens next in Iran after Ayatollah Khamenei’s death?
Word of the Week is Durand Line. How a British-drawn border is at the heart of the Pakistan-Afghanistan ‘open war’
How Carney’s visit has revived strategic convergence in Indo-Canadian ties
item.description: As both India and Canada share numerous commonalities and convergences on global, regional and bilateral issues of concern, there is significant scope for consolidation and enhanced synergy in their ties beyond occasional strains

item.title: How PM Modi’s Israel visit aligns with both India’s interests and ideals
item.description: In an era of unreliable allies, shifting power architectures, and an increasingly fragmented global order, India is forging relationships that serve its interests and its ideals. This isn't a contradiction; it's diplomatic sophistication

item.title: How PM Modi’s Israel visit has created a rare opportunity to turn vision into reality
item.description: Israel must seize this moment to build a genuinely strategic partnership with the world's fastest-rising power

item.title: Paranoid Trump is trying to constrict India’s policy autonomy, but we are the new indispensable power
item.description: The world, especially the middle powers and the Global South, want India to be successful and are vesting in its success

item.title: This Holi, skip the rush: Explore the hidden Mewar around Udaipur
item.description: When Udaipur feels overrun, the real magic of Mewar begins just beyond its city limits

item.title: How Modi and Xi present contrasting models of parliamentary outreach and global influence
item.description: PM Modi’s 19 parliamentary speeches, compared to Xi’s few, show that soft power thrives on authenticity, inclusion, and respect for institutions. They challenge China’s dominance narrative and demonstrate that emerging powers can build influence through democratic dialogue, not just summits and boardrooms
